lines.gurmukhi: nwr kY Bqwr kY snyh piqbRqw huie gurisK eyk tyk piqbRq lIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Naar Kai Bhataar Kai Sanayh Patibrataa Hui , Gursikh Ayk Tayk Patibrat Leen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wife is considered faithful who lives life in the love of her husband. So does an obedient Sikh of the Guru take refuge of one Guru-God Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd bwd Aau sMbwd piqbRq huie ibnu gur sbd n kwn isK dIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Baad Au Sanbaad Patibrat Hui , Binu Gur Sabad N Kaan Sikh Deen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a husband enjoys the subject of mode of singing musical instruments and other conversation, so does a Sikh in the service of the Guru talks and listens nothing other than the sound of the divine words of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: rUp rMg AMg srbMg hyry piqbRqw Awn dyv syvk n drsn kIn hY
lines.transliteration_english: Roop Rang Ang Sarabang Hayray Patibrataa , Aan Dayv Sayvak N Darasan Keen Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a faithful wife admires the good looks, colour and beauty of all limbs of her husband, so does a devoted Sikh neither is the follower of any god nor proceeds to see any. Other than one True Guru, the form of True Master, he looks at no one else.

lines.gurmukhi: sujn kutMb giiH gaun krY piqbRqw Awn dyv sQwn jYsy jil ibnu mIn hY ]449]
lines.transliteration_english: Sujan Koutanb Grihi Gaoun Karai Patibrataa , Aan Dayv Sadaan Jaisay Jali Binu Meen Hai ?449?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a faithful wife lives amongst the close relatives in her house and goes nowhere else; so does the Sikh of the Guru go nowhere else other than the court of the True Guru and assembly of His devoted and loving Sikhs. Places of other gods and goddess
